alert.note: Alert for Buchanan (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 25 at 8:53AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Buchanan, western McDowell, Mingo, west central Wyoming and southwestern Logan Counties through 930 AM EDT... At 852 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Chattaroy to near Gilbert Creek. Movement was south at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Williamson, Grundy, War, Delbarton, R.d. Bailey Lake, Gilbert Creek, South Williamson, Big Rock, Red Jacket, Chattaroy, Paw Paw, Aflex, Hinch, Matewan, Gilbert, Bradshaw, Iaeger, Myrtle, Jolo, and Hurley. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
